intro: Picea excelsa f. bidentata, commonly known as the Himalayan giant fir, is a variant of the white fir native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. This coniferous tree is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and dense, pyramidal crown. Its needles are long, flat, and have a distinctive two-toothed margin, giving it its specific epithet "bidentata." The tree thrives in cold, moist environments and is adapted to high-altitude conditions with limited sunlight. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing habitat and food for various alpine species.
